events.event_description: U.S. battery storage capacity is expected to increase by 89% by the end of 2024, with developers planning to expand capacity to more than 30 gigawatts.
events.citation: U.S. battery storage capacity has been growing since 2021 and could increase by 89% by the end of 2024 if developers bring all of the energy storage systems they have planned on line by their intended commercial operation dates. Developers currently plan to expand U.S. battery capacity to more than 30 gigawatts (GW) by the end of 2024

events.event_description: California leads U.S. states in installed battery storage capacity with 7.3 GW, followed by Texas with 3.2 GW.
events.citation: California has the most installed battery storage capacity of any state, with 7.3 GW, followed by Texas with 3.2 GW.

events.event_description: Developers plan to add 15 GW of battery storage capacity in 2024 and around 9 GW in 2025.
events.citation: Developers plan to add another 15 GW in 2024 and around 9 GW in 2025, according to our latest Preliminary Monthly Electric Generator Inventory.

events.event_description: The Moss Landing Energy Storage Facility in California, owned by Vistra, is currently the largest battery storage facility in operation in the U.S. with 750 megawatts capacity.
events.citation: The battery storage facility owned by Vistra and located at Moss Landing in California is currently the largest in operation in the country, with 750 megawatts (MW).
